p: An earlier paper [ 101], examining two EOs from aerial parts, registered the following main components: ( Z)-ocimenone (9.1–26.3%), ( E)-ocimenone (9.6–26.3%), dihydrotagetone (13.4–17.3%), tagetones (5.5–12.9%), limonene (8.7–10.2%), and β-ocimene (tr–6.0%). Of particular interest was the presence in one EO of significant quantities of thujone (11.9%). According to the recent review by Gupta [ 55], the EOs are characterized by dihydrotagetone, tagetones, ocimenones, and piperitone. One of the review papers [ 39] gave a breakdown of the composition of leaves and flowers, which were fairly consistent, with ( E)-tagetenone, dihydrotagetone, ( E)-tagetone, and ( Z)-β-ocimene as the four main components. The only notable difference was that the leaf EOs contained 2.2% methylchavicol, while the flowers contained 2.0% camphor.
